<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 277, 232, 294]]<|/det|>
## MATHEMATICS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[836, 278, 907, 294]]<|/det|>
9709/32  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 303, 312, 319]]<|/det|>
Paper 3 Pure Mathematics 3  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[710, 303, 907, 320]]<|/det|>
October/November 2021  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[760, 329, 907, 345]]<|/det|>
1 hour 50 minutes  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 357, 395, 373]]<|/det|>
You must answer on the question paper.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 384, 390, 400]]<|/det|>
You will need: List of formulae (MF19)  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 418, 225, 434]]<|/det|>
## INSTRUCTIONS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 435, 880, 632]]<|/det|>
INSTRUCTIONS- Answer all questions.- Use a black or dark blue pen. You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs.- Write your name, centre number and candidate number in the boxes at the top of the page.- Write your answer to each question in the space provided.- Do not use an erasable pen or correction fluid.- Do not write on any bar codes.- If additional space is needed, you should use the lined page at the end of this booklet; the question number or numbers must be clearly shown.- You should use a calculator where appropriate.- You must show all necessary working clearly; no marks will be given for unsupported answers from a calculator.- Give non-exact numerical answers correct to 3 significant figures, or 1 decimal place for angles in degrees, unless a different level of accuracy is specified in the question.  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 664, 216, 679]]<|/det|>
## INFORMATION  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 680, 732, 712]]<|/det|>
INFORMATION- The total mark for this paper is 75.- The number of marks for each question or part question is shown in brackets [ ].

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 78, 97, 97]]<|/det|>
<label>1</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 72, 920, 120]]<|/det|>
Find the value of \(x\) for which \(3(2^{1 - x}) = 7^{x}\). Give your answer in the form \(\frac{\ln a}{\ln b}\), where \(a\) and \(b\) are integers.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[892, 98, 920, 116]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 73, 96, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>2</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 73, 688, 92]]<|/det|>
Solve the inequality \(|3x - a| > 2|x + 2a|\), where \(a\) is a positive constant.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 73, 920, 92]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 74, 96, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>3</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 74, 146, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 73, 920, 108]]<|/det|>
Given the complex numbers \(u = a + \mathrm{i}b\) and \(w = c + \mathrm{i}d\), where \(a\), \(b\), \(c\) and \(d\) are real, prove that \((u + w)^{*} = u^{*} + w^{*}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 87, 920, 106]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 395, 191, 414]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 395, 920, 429]]<|/det|>
Solve the equation \((z + 2 + \mathrm{i})^{*} + (2 + \mathrm{i})z = 0\), giving your answer in the form \(x + \mathrm{i}y\) where \(x\) and \(y\) are real.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 412, 920, 431]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 73, 96, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>5</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 73, 146, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 72, 920, 109]]<|/det|>
On a sketch of an Argand diagram, shade the region whose points represent complex numbers \(z\) satisfying the inequalities \(|z - 3 - 2\mathrm{i}| \leqslant 1\) and \(\operatorname {Im}z \geqslant 2\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 87, 920, 106]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 504, 148, 521]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 503, 905, 522]]<|/det|>
Find the greatest value of \(\arg z\) for points in the shaded region, giving your answer in degrees.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 518, 920, 537]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 75, 94, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>6</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 75, 148, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 73, 672, 92]]<|/det|>
Using the expansions of \(\sin (3x + 2x)\) and \(\sin (3x - 2x)\), show that

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[371, 100, 626, 121]]<|/det|>
\[\frac{1}{2} (\sin 5x + \sin x) \equiv \sin 3x \cos 2x.\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 100, 920, 119]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 73, 97, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>7</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 73, 544, 92]]<|/det|>
The variables \(x\) and \(y\) satisfy the differential equation

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[438, 100, 556, 129]]<|/det|>
\[\mathrm{e}^{2x}\frac{\mathrm{dy}}{\mathrm{dx}} = 4xy^{2},\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 136, 411, 156]]<|/det|>
and it is given that \(y = 1\) when \(x = 0\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 168, 712, 186]]<|/det|>
Solve the differential equation, obtaining an expression for \(y\) in terms of \(x\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 168, 920, 186]]<|/det|>
<mark>[7]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 73, 94, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>9</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 73, 455, 92]]<|/det|>
The equation of a curve is \(y\mathrm{e}^{2x} - y^{2}\mathrm{e}^{x} = 2.\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 109, 146, 129]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[148, 104, 376, 131]]<|/det|>
Show that \(\frac{\mathrm{dy}}{\mathrm{dx}} = \frac{2y\mathrm{e}^{x} - y^{2}}{2y - \mathrm{e}^{x}}.\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 114, 920, 131]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 73, 148, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 73, 905, 92]]<|/det|>
Find the exact coordinates of the point on the curve where the tangent is parallel to the \(y\)-axis.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 88, 920, 106]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 73, 146, 91]]<|/det|>
<label>(c)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 72, 742, 92]]<|/det|>
Find the possible position vectors of the point \(P\) on \(l\) such that \(OP = \sqrt{14}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 73, 920, 92]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]
